name: Congenital Ventricular Septal Defect with Eisenmenger Syndrome
chief_complaint: My child gets tired easily and turns blue when playing
physical_findings: loud holosystolic murmur at lower left sternal border
prognosis: Guarded; depends on response to medical management and timing of potential transplant
description: A congenital heart defect where there's a hole in the ventricular septum, leading to left-to-right shunting that eventually causes pulmonary hypertension and reversal of shunt direction (Eisenmenger physiology). This represents an advanced, irreversible stage of the condition.
risk_factors: family history of congenital heart disease
